item.title: HowTo play with SNMP
item.author: troglobit@gmail.com (Joachim Nilsson)
item.description: This mini HowTo is about how you can use SNMP client tools to retrieve human readable information from devices running an SNMP daemon. In the examples below mini-snmpd is used as the daemon and as client both the command line net-snmp tool and the snmpB GUI are used. Personally I use both Ubuntu and Debian, so the tools I use to download the clients will reflect that. See your respective UNIX distro’s help pages for how to install these client tools in your operating system.
